alert.note: Alert for Coleman; Concho; McCulloch; Runnels (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 22 at 4:19PM CDT until April 22 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Coleman County in west central Texas... Northern McCulloch County in west central Texas... Southeastern Runnels County in west central Texas... Northeastern Concho County in west central Texas... * Until 515 PM CDT. * At 419 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Ivie Reservoir Near Concho Park Marina, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Ivie Reservoir Near Concho Park Marina around 430 PM CDT. Leaday around 435 PM CDT. Voss and Stacy around 445 PM CDT. Gouldbusk around 455 PM CDT. Rockwood and Waldrip around 510 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include The Intersection Of Ranch Road 1929 And Ranch Road 2134, Fife, Mozelle, Whon, Us-283 Near The Mcculloch- Coleman County Line, Fisk and Shields. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
